Chest medicine
Fig 4.6 PA chest radiograph showing multiple rounded ring lesions of diff ering sizes in the right 
lower zone, at the right apex, and in the left lower zone. The lesions are largest in the right low-
er zone, where they can be seen to contain air-ﬂ uid levels, typical appearance of infection in a 
pneumatocele (=air cyst) or cavitating lesion. A moderate right-sided hydropneumothorax can also 
be seen, suggesting that one of these lesions may have ruptured into the pleural cavity. The patient 
also has a right subclavian central venous catheter for the administration of antibiotics. The diag-
nosis in this case was that of multiple pulmonary abscesses in a patient who was an intravenous 
drug user.
